intro: Homalium napimoga, commonly known as the Napimoga beautyberry, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. It produces clusters of small, white flowers followed by blue-black berries that are edible for some bird species. The plant's ornamental value is enhanced by its attractive foliage and seasonal fruit display.
